meanings.definition: A person who assesses the monetary worth or quality of something.
meanings.sent1: The valuer inspected the antique vase to determine its value.
meanings.sent2: The valuer at the auction house appraised the painting before the bidding started.
meanings.sent3: The valuer chuckled as he realized the old comic book was worth a fortune.
meanings.sent4: She was a valuer of rare gems, able to spot a diamond in the rough.
meanings.sent5: The valuer's keen eye spotted the hidden treasure in the cluttered attic.

meanings.definition: To consider something to be important or beneficial.
meanings.sent1: I valuer my family above all else in my life.
meanings.sent2: She valuers honesty and integrity in her relationships.
meanings.sent3: The children valuer their toys more than anything else.
meanings.sent4: In her eyes, he was the valuer of all things good and true.
meanings.sent5: He valuered the simple joys of life, finding happiness in the little things.
